byline.contributor: Joseph Orovic contributed reporting from Zadar, Croatia; Matthew Brunwasser from Belgrade, Serbia; and Barbara Surk from Ljubljana, Slovenia.

abstract: Croatia blames computer problems for closing of its border under strain of refugees, prompting bitter response from Serbia invoking Croatia's fascist past; European migrant crisis is reawakening past tensions between Balkan states, undermining economic and political progress made since bloody 1990s breakup of Yugoslavia.
lead_paragraph: Serbia said on Thursday that the police had begun to enforce a ban on Croatian goods and cargo vehicles entering the country, prompting a stern rebuke.

headline.main: Croatia and Serbia Trade Barbs as Migration Crisis Strains Ties
headline.print_headline: Croatia and Serbia Trade Barbs as Migration Crisis Strains Ties

snippet: Serbia said on Thursday that the police had begun to enforce a ban on Croatian goods and cargo vehicles entering the country, prompting a stern rebuke.
